info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 1:42PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL LUZERNE COUNTY THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 142 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mountain Top, or 8 miles north of Hazleton, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilkes-Barre, Freeland, Ashley, Dorrance, White Haven, Preston, Sugar Notch, Nuangola, Warrior Run, and Laurel Run. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 80 near 262. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 155 and 165. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern Pennsylvania.
